alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 12:24PM MDT until April 13 at 7:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Battle Creek near Chinook affecting Blaine County. .Melting snowpack will cause river rises and flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Battle Creek near Chinook. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, At 12 Feet...flooding usually is occurring over northern/central Blaine County along Battle Creek. Runoff from Cypress Hills in southern Canada could be the source of the water. Empty grain bins could be washed away. (March 2017) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM MDT Wednesday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to around 9 feet tonight and hold steady thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 04/08/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed or by Thursday morning at 700 AM MDT.
